title: Climate change: Whisper it cautiously... there's been progress in run up to COP26
description: Pledges made at the UN have lifted hopes for the Glasgow summit, but some major questions remain.

title: Week in pictures: 18 - 24 September 2021
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Switzerland to hold referendum on same-sex marriage
description: Voters in Switzerland go to the polls this Sunday to decide whether to allow same-sex marriage.

title: Attacked by a hyena: My advice for a fellow victim
description: Nine-year-old Rodwell Nkomazana lost an eye, his nose, and his upper lip when he was mauled by a hyena.

title: A look back at some of the most awkward moments at conference
description: From Theresa May's incident-strewn speech in 2017 to Tony Blair sweating through his shirt.

title: Ros Atkins On… Germany’s election explained
description: Ros Atkins explains how Germany’s election works, the candidates and the issues at stake.

title: Afghanistan: Inside the prison staffed by former inmates released by the Taliban
description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen goes inside Kabul's main jail, where former Taliban inmates are now caretakers.

title: Joshua v Usyk - all you need to know about Saturday's showdown
description: BBC Sport previews Anthony Joshua's 11th successive world title bout as he fights Oleksandr Usyk in front of more than 65,000 people.

title: Meng Wanzhou: The PowerPoint that sparked an international row
description: After three years, Huawei's chief financial officer has a US extradition request against her dropped.

title: Prince Andrew's lawyers accept he was served with US case papers
description: Virginia Giuffre is claiming damages from Prince Andrew over allegations he sexually assaulted her.

title: Ryder Cup: Bryson DeChambeau hits 'huge' 417-yard drive
description: Watch as Bryson DeChambeau hits an ''absurd'' 417-yard drive on day one of the Ryder Cup at Whistling Straits in Wisconsin.

title: Warning after Lewes girl, 6, has surgery for swallowing magnets
description: The girl had swallowed 23 strong magnets, which ripped through her bowel.

title: One of NYC's poshest buildings facing $250m lawsuit over building defects
description: A posh building on NYC's Billionaire Row has been facing a series of serious woes.

title: Raducanu takes on Duchess of Cambridge
description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu says she was "more nervous playing the Duchess of Cambridge" before her Homecoming Party than during the US Open final.

title: Sabina Nessa killing: Does following the 'rules' keep women safe?
description: Safety tips for women continue to suggest murderers have an excuse for killing.

title: Petrol will continue to flow, says transport secretary
description: The transport secretary says fuel will "continue to flow" and drivers should buy as normal.

title: Narendra Modi: The China factor in Delhi's Quad strategy
description: The 'Quad' - India, Australia, Japan and the US - are meeting for the first time as a group.

title: England claim first series win in New Zealand after thrilling final-quarter fightback
description: England claim a first ever series win in New Zealand as a final-quarter fightback helps them beat the world champions 49-45 in Christchurch.

description: Carles Puigdemont is wanted over a failed bid to win independence for the Catalonia region.

title: Afghanistan: Executions will return, says senior Taliban official

title: Killamarsh: Man in crown court charged with murders of children and woman

description: The Notting Hill star says she was "fortunate" to have worked with its director, who has died at 65.

description: A lacklustre lead candidate and a surprisingly strong Social Democrat have blown the race wide open.

description: The arrest of a man on suspicion of the murder of Sabina Nessa also makes many of Friday's front pages.

title: Hospitality staff set to keep all their tips under rule change
description: The government is set to make it illegal for hospitality bosses to withhold tips from their workers.

title: Keir Starmer is taking a big risk
description: As Labour conference approaches, Sir Keir Starmer intends to take the fight to his critics inside the party.

title: LGBT freshers: 'I worried Oxford wouldn't accept me'

title: The Magic Circle appoints its youngest, and first female, president
